sourcesContent:
import React from 'react';
import {
  Box,
  Container,
  Tabs,
  TabList,
  Tab,
  TabPanels,
  TabPanel,
  Heading,
  Text,
  Link,
  VStack,
  UnorderedList,
  ListItem,
  useColorModeValue,
} from '@chakra-ui/react';

const TabContent = () => {
  const bgColor = useColorModeValue('white', 'gray.800');
  const borderColor = useColorModeValue('gray.200', 'gray.600');

  return (
    <Box bg={bgColor} minH="100vh" py={8}>
      <Container maxW="container.xl">
        <Tabs isLazy variant="enclosed" colorScheme="blue">
          <TabList mb="1em" overflowX="auto" flexWrap="nowrap">
            <Tab>Homepage</Tab>
            <Tab>Why Global Inclusion Matters</Tab>
            <Tab>Barriers to Inclusive Red Teaming</Tab>
            <Tab>Enabling Participation</Tab>
            <Tab>Domain-Specific Governance</Tab>
            <Tab>Global Coordination</Tab>
            <Tab>Resources</Tab>
          </TabList>

          <TabPanels>
            {/* Homepage Tab */}
            <TabPanel>
              <VStack spacing={6} align="stretch">
                <Heading as="h2" size="xl">
                  Inclusive Global AI Governance and Red Teaming Homepage
                </Heading>
                <Text>
                  AI's rapid advances are unevenly distributed across the world. Most AI development and investment are concentrated in a few countries (primarily in the Global North), yet its impacts will be felt globally, often by populations with little say in its design.
                </Text>
                <Text>
                  This disconnect is stark: a PwC analysis estimates that by 2030, 84% of AI's economic gains will accrue to North America, Europe, and China, while only about 8% of the benefits reach all of Africa, Oceania and the rest of Asia combined. Global inequality is set to rise as countries leading in AI reap outsized rewards and those facing adoption barriers fall further behind.
                </Text>
                <Text>
                  If AI governance remains non-inclusive, there is a risk that a few cultural and economic perspectives will dominate, imposing one-size-fits-all policies and values that may not suit local contexts. Without diverse voices, AI policies might overlook regional needs or ethical norms, and AI systems could carry hidden biases.
                </Text>
                <Text>
                  For example, advanced language models already show geographic biases that favor high-income regions. Failing to involve Global South stakeholders in rule-making could mean Global North values and assumptions are baked into AI systems worldwide, to the detriment of other cultures. Inclusive global governance aims to correct this imbalance by engaging a broad coalition of nations and experts in shaping AI's future.
                </Text>
              </VStack>
            </TabPanel>

            {/* Why Global Inclusion Matters Tab */}
            <TabPanel>
              <VStack spacing={6} align="stretch">
                <Heading as="h2" size="xl">
                  Why Global Inclusion Matters
                </Heading>
                <Text>
                  Inclusive red teaming and development bring diverse perspectives to the table, leading to more robust and fair AI systems. There are many concrete examples of how lack of inclusion has caused harm – and how broader input can add value.
                </Text>
                
                <Box>
                  <Heading as="h3" size="md" mb={3}>
                    Linguistic & Geographic Bias
                  </Heading>
                  <Text>
                    AI systems often perform poorly for languages or communities absent in training data. Independent researchers have found that large language models (trained mostly on English and European data) carry "geographic bias" – for instance, systematically underrating content related to African countries on subjective qualities like "intelligence" or "morality".
                  </Text>
                  <Text mt={3}>
                    Generative AI tools also struggle with many low-resource languages, leading to errors and exclusion of non-English speakers. These biases can amplify inequality (e.g. an AI assistant that works well in English but garbles Swahili is far less useful to African users).
                  </Text>
                </Box>

                <Box>
                  <Heading as="h3" size="md" mb={3}>
                    Health & Safety Risks
                  </Heading>
                  <Text>
                    If AI applications (like medical diagnosis tools) are developed using homogenous data, they can be dangerously unreliable for underrepresented groups. For example, an AI system for skin cancer screening was found to be less accurate on patients with darker skin, because most training images were of light-skinned individuals.
                  </Text>
                </Box>

                <Box>
                  <Heading as="h3" size="md" mb={3}>
                    Cultural Mismatches & Fairness
                  </Heading>
                  <Text>
                    AI systems often reflect the cultural context of their creators, which can cause problems when deployed globally. Generative AI models have been caught reinforcing stereotypes – for instance, a text-to-image generator trained on Western data might depict Indian festivals in an exotified, caricatured way.
                  </Text>
                </Box>
              </VStack>
            </TabPanel>

            {/* Barriers to Inclusive Red Teaming Tab */}
            <TabPanel>
              <VStack spacing={6} align="stretch">
                <Heading as="h2" size="xl">
                  Barriers to Inclusive Red Teaming
                </Heading>
                
                <Box>
                  <Heading as="h3" size="md" mb={3}>
                    Legal and Regulatory Barriers
                  </Heading>
                  <Text>
                    Many countries have unclear or restrictive laws around AI system testing. This creates legal uncertainty that discourages participation in red teaming efforts. Key issues include:
                  </Text>
                  <UnorderedList mt={2} spacing={2}>
                    <ListItem>Computer misuse and cybersecurity laws that may criminalize certain testing approaches</ListItem>
                    <ListItem>Intellectual property restrictions limiting access to model details</ListItem>
                    <ListItem>Data protection regulations affecting testing data collection and sharing</ListItem>
                    <ListItem>Export controls on AI technologies that prevent cross-border collaboration</ListItem>
                  </UnorderedList>
                </Box>

                <Box>
                  <Heading as="h3" size="md" mb={3}>
                    Resource and Infrastructure Gaps
                  </Heading>
                  <Text>
                    Many regions face significant resource constraints that limit their ability to participate in AI development and testing:
                  </Text>
                  <UnorderedList mt={2} spacing={2}>
                    <ListItem>Limited access to computing infrastructure and high-performance hardware</ListItem>
                    <ListItem>Insufficient funding for AI research and testing initiatives</ListItem>
                    <ListItem>Lack of specialized training programs and educational resources</ListItem>
                    <ListItem>Poor internet connectivity and digital infrastructure in some areas</ListItem>
                  </UnorderedList>
                </Box>

                <Box>
                  <Heading as="h3" size="md" mb={3}>
                    Knowledge and Expertise Barriers
                  </Heading>
                  <Text>
                    Technical expertise is often concentrated in a few global hubs, creating challenges for broader participation:
                  </Text>
                  <UnorderedList mt={2} spacing={2}>
                    <ListItem>Limited access to advanced AI training and education</ListItem>
                    <ListItem>Language barriers in technical documentation and research</ListItem>
                    <ListItem>Brain drain of AI talent to major tech hubs</ListItem>
                    <ListItem>Lack of local mentorship and professional development opportunities</ListItem>
                  </UnorderedList>
                </Box>
              </VStack>
            </TabPanel>

            {/* Enabling Participation Tab */}
            <TabPanel>
              <VStack spacing={6} align="stretch">
                <Heading as="h2" size="xl">
                  Enabling Participation
                </Heading>
                
                <Box>
                  <Heading as="h3" size="md" mb={3}>
                    Legal and Policy Solutions
                  </Heading>
                  <Text>
                    Creating an enabling environment for global participation requires addressing legal barriers through:
                  </Text>
                  <UnorderedList mt={2} spacing={2}>
                    <ListItem>Safe harbor provisions for legitimate AI testing activities</ListItem>
                    <ListItem>Clear guidelines on permissible testing approaches</ListItem>
                    <ListItem>International frameworks for cross-border collaboration</ListItem>
                    <ListItem>Standardized protocols for responsible disclosure</ListItem>
                  </UnorderedList>
                </Box>

                <Box>
                  <Heading as="h3" size="md" mb={3}>
                    Capacity Building Initiatives
                  </Heading>
                  <Text>
                    Supporting the development of local expertise and infrastructure through:
                  </Text>
                  <UnorderedList mt={2} spacing={2}>
                    <ListItem>Regional AI research and testing centers</ListItem>
                    <ListItem>Training programs and educational partnerships</ListItem>
                    <ListItem>Funding for local AI safety initiatives</ListItem>
                    <ListItem>Technical resource sharing programs</ListItem>
                  </UnorderedList>
                </Box>

                <Box>
                  <Heading as="h3" size="md" mb={3}>
                    Collaborative Networks
                  </Heading>
                  <Text>
                    Building networks to connect global participants:
                  </Text>
                  <UnorderedList mt={2} spacing={2}>
                    <ListItem>International research partnerships</ListItem>
                    <ListItem>Mentorship programs connecting experts with emerging practitioners</ListItem>
                    <ListItem>Knowledge sharing platforms and communities of practice</ListItem>
                    <ListItem>Regular conferences and workshops focused on inclusive AI safety</ListItem>
                  </UnorderedList>
                </Box>
              </VStack>
            </TabPanel>

            {/* Domain-Specific Governance Tab */}
            <TabPanel>
              <VStack spacing={6} align="stretch">
                <Heading as="h2" size="xl">
                  Domain-Specific Governance
                </Heading>
                
                <Box>
                  <Heading as="h3" size="md" mb={3}>
                    Healthcare AI
                  </Heading>
                  <Text>
                    Special considerations for AI systems in healthcare:
                  </Text>
                  <UnorderedList mt={2} spacing={2}>
                    <ListItem>Patient data privacy and protection requirements</ListItem>
                    <ListItem>Medical device regulations and safety standards</ListItem>
                    <ListItem>Cultural sensitivity in healthcare delivery</ListItem>
                    <ListItem>Access and equity considerations</ListItem>
                  </UnorderedList>
                </Box>

                <Box>
                  <Heading as="h3" size="md" mb={3}>
                    Financial Services
                  </Heading>
                  <Text>
                    Governance frameworks for AI in financial applications:
                  </Text>
                  <UnorderedList mt={2} spacing={2}>
                    <ListItem>Fair lending and anti-discrimination requirements</ListItem>
                    <ListItem>Risk management and system stability considerations</ListItem>
                    <ListItem>Consumer protection measures</ListItem>
                    <ListItem>Cross-border financial regulations</ListItem>
                  </UnorderedList>
                </Box>

                <Box>
                  <Heading as="h3" size="md" mb={3}>
                    Public Sector Applications
                  </Heading>
                  <Text>
                    Guidelines for government use of AI:
                  </Text>
                  <UnorderedList mt={2} spacing={2}>
                    <ListItem>Transparency and accountability requirements</ListItem>
                    <ListItem>Public consultation processes</ListItem>
                    <ListItem>Impact assessments for vulnerable populations</ListItem>
                    <ListItem>Democratic oversight mechanisms</ListItem>
                  </UnorderedList>
                </Box>
              </VStack>
            </TabPanel>

            {/* Global Coordination Tab */}
            <TabPanel>
              <VStack spacing={6} align="stretch">
                <Heading as="h2" size="xl">
                  Global Coordination
                </Heading>
                
                <Box>
                  <Heading as="h3" size="md" mb={3}>
                    International Frameworks
                  </Heading>
                  <Text>
                    Developing coordinated approaches to AI governance:
                  </Text>
                  <UnorderedList mt={2} spacing={2}>
                    <ListItem>Multilateral agreements on AI safety standards</ListItem>
                    <ListItem>Shared principles for responsible AI development</ListItem>
                    <ListItem>Cross-border incident response protocols</ListItem>
                    <ListItem>International monitoring and enforcement mechanisms</ListItem>
                  </UnorderedList>
                </Box>

                <Box>
                  <Heading as="h3" size="md" mb={3}>
                    Regional Cooperation
                  </Heading>
                  <Text>
                    Building regional capacity and coordination:
                  </Text>
                  <UnorderedList mt={2} spacing={2}>
                    <ListItem>Regional AI safety centers and networks</ListItem>
                    <ListItem>Shared research and testing infrastructure</ListItem>
                    <ListItem>Harmonized regulatory approaches</ListItem>
                    <ListItem>Joint capacity building initiatives</ListItem>
                  </UnorderedList>
                </Box>

                <Box>
                  <Heading as="h3" size="md" mb={3}>
                    Stakeholder Engagement
                  </Heading>
                  <Text>
                    Ensuring inclusive participation in governance:
                  </Text>
                  <UnorderedList mt={2} spacing={2}>
                    <ListItem>Multi-stakeholder dialogue processes</ListItem>
                    <ListItem>Civil society participation mechanisms</ListItem>
                    <ListItem>Industry-government partnerships</ListItem>
                    <ListItem>Academic and research collaboration networks</ListItem>
                  </UnorderedList>
                </Box>
              </VStack>
            </TabPanel>

            {/* Resources Tab */}
            <TabPanel>
              <VStack spacing={8} align="stretch">
                <Heading as="h2" size="xl">
                  Resources
                </Heading>
                
                <Box>
                  <Heading as="h3" size="lg" mb={4}>
                    Global AI Governance Frameworks
                  </Heading>
                  <UnorderedList spacing={3}>
                    <ListItem>
                      <Link href="https://oecd.ai/en/ai-principles" isExternal color="blue.500">
                        OECD AI Principles (2019)
                      </Link>
                      : Multilateral principles for Trustworthy AI, endorsed by 40+ countries.
                    </ListItem>
                    <ListItem>
                      <Link href="https://en.unesco.org/artificial-intelligence/ethics" isExternal color="blue.500">
                        UNESCO Recommendation on AI Ethics (2021)
                      </Link>
                      : Landmark agreement by 193 countries.
                    </ListItem>
                    <ListItem>
                      <Link href="https://digital-strategy.ec.europa.eu/en/policies/regulatory-framework-ai" isExternal color="blue.500">
                        EU Artificial Intelligence Act
                      </Link>
                      : Comprehensive AI law with risk-based approach.
                    </ListItem>
                  </UnorderedList>
                </Box>

                <Box>
                  <Heading as="h3" size="lg" mb={4}>
                    Inclusive AI & Case Studies of Bias
                  </Heading>
                  <UnorderedList spacing={3}>
                    <ListItem>
                      "Large Language Models are Geographically Biased" (Manvi et al. 2024): Research on LLM performance/bias across countries.
                    </ListItem>
                    <ListItem>
                      Penn State/Univ. of Washington Study on Cultural Harm: Analysis of generative AI misrepresenting Indian contexts.
                    </ListItem>
                    <ListItem>
                      Gender and Language Bias in AI Translation: e.g., Google Translate case study.
                    </ListItem>
                  </UnorderedList>
                </Box>

                <Box>
                  <Heading as="h3" size="lg" mb={4}>
                    Red Teaming, Safety, and Cybersecurity Analogies
                  </Heading>
                  <UnorderedList spacing={3}>
                    <ListItem>
                      <Link href="https://knightcolumbia.org/content/a-safe-harbor-for-ai-red-teaming" isExternal color="blue.500">
                        Knight Institute – "A Safe Harbor for AI Red Teaming" (Nov 2023)
                      </Link>
                      : Argues for legal protections.
                    </ListItem>
                    <ListItem>
                      <Link href="https://www.nist.gov/itl/ai-risk-management-framework" isExternal color="blue.500">
                        NIST AI Risk Management Framework 1.0
                      </Link>
                      : Governance section provides guidelines.
                    </ListItem>
                  </UnorderedList>
                </Box>
              </VStack>
            </TabPanel>
          </TabPanels>
        </Tabs>
      </Container>
    </Box>
  );
};

export default TabContent;
